title: [e_commerce] Low Conversion Rate
description: The average conversion rate across web sessions is only 9%, which is significantly lower than industry benchmarks of 2-5% for e-commerce. This indicates that a large number of visitors are not completing purchases.
business_impact: Improving the conversion rate can lead to increased revenue and better return on marketing investments.

title: [e_commerce] Increased Cancellation Rate
description: The cancellation rate is concerning, with 13 out of 500 orders marked as cancelled. This represents a 2.6% cancellation rate, which could indicate issues in order fulfillment or customer satisfaction.
business_impact: Reducing cancellations can improve customer satisfaction and increase overall sales.

title: High Missing Data in user_id
description: 295 records (29.5%) have missing values in user_id

title: Cancelled Status
description: Found 29 records (5.8%) with 'cancelled' status in orders
business_impact: Revenue impact from 29 items (5.8%)

title: [e_commerce] High Average Lifetime Value
description: The average lifetime value of customers is 93,798.02, indicating that customers are potentially valuable over time. However, the distribution may be skewed due to a few high-value customers.
recommendations: Segment high-value customers for personalized marketing
Analyze factors contributing to high lifetime value
business_impact: Understanding and enhancing customer lifetime value can lead to improved customer loyalty and profitability.

title: [e_commerce] Stock Levels and Product Availability
description: The average stock quantity is 227.34, but there are products with very low stock levels. This could lead to stockouts, affecting sales and customer satisfaction.
business_impact: Ensuring adequate stock levels can prevent lost sales opportunities and improve customer satisfaction.

title: [e_commerce] Over-reliance on Online Acquisition Channel
description: The majority of customers are acquired online (48 out of 200), which may pose a risk if online marketing effectiveness declines or if there are changes in digital advertising regulations.
business_impact: Diversifying customer acquisition channels can reduce risk and ensure a stable flow of new customers.

title: [e_commerce] Low Conversion Rate
description: The average conversion rate is only 9%, indicating that a significant majority of web sessions do not lead to conversions. This could suggest issues with the website's user experience or the effectiveness of marketing efforts.
recommendations: Conduct A/B testing on landing pages
business_impact: Improving the conversion rate can lead to increased sales and revenue.

title: [e_commerce] Product Stock Imbalance
description: The average stock quantity is 227, but some products have very low stock levels. This imbalance can lead to stockouts for popular items and excess inventory for others, affecting sales and customer satisfaction.
recommendations: Analyze sales trends to adjust stock levels
business_impact: Optimizing stock levels can enhance customer satisfaction and reduce holding costs.

title: [e_commerce] High Average Discount Rate
description: The average discount rate is 7%, with some orders having discounts as high as 20%. This may indicate a reliance on discounts to drive sales, which could erode profit margins.
recommendations: Consider loyalty programs instead of discounts
Analyze customer segments for targeted promotions
business_impact: Reducing reliance on discounts can improve profit margins and customer perceived value.

title: [e_commerce] Underutilization of Mobile Channel
description: While mobile is a significant acquisition channel, it only accounts for 24% of customers. This suggests potential underutilization of mobile marketing strategies.
recommendations: Analyze mobile user behavior for insights
business_impact: Leveraging mobile more effectively can increase customer acquisition and engagement.

title: [e_commerce] Inactive Customer Segment
description: There are 13 inactive customers in the dataset, which may indicate a need for re-engagement strategies. This segment could represent lost revenue opportunities.
business_impact: Reactivating inactive customers can significantly boost revenue without the cost of acquiring new customers.
